options.name: super_admin
options.description: This includes the configurations related to the super admin user.

params.name: username
params.description: super admin username

params.name: password
params.description: super admin password

params.name: create_admin_account
params.description: Set this to true to create a new user with the super admin details given.

configs.title: Connecting to the primary data store

options.name: server
options.description: This groups the parameters that define the server node details.

params.name: hostname
params.description: The hostname of the WSO2 API-M server instance.

params.name: node_ip
params.description: The IP address of the server node.

options.name: database_configuration
options.description: Configurations required to enable browsing the H2 database from a web browser.

params.name: enable_h2_console
params.description: True when required to browser the H2 database from a browser. False when not.

options.name: database.apim_db
options.description: Database configurations related to API Manager

params.name: type
params.description: Database vendor

params.name: hostname
params.description: You can use either hostname and port or the URL(given below). If you specify the URL the hostname and port will be overridden.

params.name: url
params.description:
The connection URL is required when you use the h2 db.

 You have to add the URL to use the JDBC properties listed below. Otherwise it is optional.

params.name: username
params.description: The username used to create a connection to the database.

params.name: password
params.description: The password used to create a connection to the database.

params.name: *validationQuery
params.description: The value changes according to the Database query

params.name: pool_options.maxActive
params.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from the connection pool at the same time. Change according to the preferred database.

params.name: pool_options.maxWait
params.description: The maximum time that requests are expected to wait in the queue for a connection to be released. This property comes into effect when the maximum number of active connections allowed in the connection pool (see maxActive property) is used up.

params.name: pool_options.testOnBorrow
params.description: The indication of whether connection objects will be validated before they are borrowed from the pool. If the object validation fails, the connection is dropped from the pool, and there will be an attempt to borrow another connection.

params.name: pool_options.validationInterval
params.description: This parameter controls how frequently a given validation query is executed (time in milliseconds). That is, if a connection is due for validation, but has been validated previously within this interval, it will not be validated again.

params.name: pool_options.defaultAutoCommit
params.description: When auto committing is enabled, each SQL statement will be committed to the database as an individual transaction, as opposed to committing multiple statements as a single transaction.

options.name: database.shared_db
options.description: Configurations related to the databases shared between nodes

params.name: type
params.description: Database type

params.name: url
params.description: connection url

params.name: username
params.description: username

params.name: password
params.description: password

options.name: apim.jwt
options.description: Enable APIM to generate a JWT within itself. JSON Web Token (JWT) is used to represent claims that are transferred between two parties such as the end-user and the backend.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable JWT.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Use base64 encoding for the default JWT generator. Use the url-safe JWT generator if it is base64url.

params.name: generator_impl
params.description: This can be defined as a custom generation implmetation. If this is defined, the "apim.jwt.encoding" will be ignored. Note that this should be the fully-qualified class name.

params.name: header
params.description: The HTTP header name used to send the JWT generated prev.

params.name: enable_user_claims
params.description: No user store claims included in the JWT if false.

params.name: claims_extractor_impl
params.description: You can define the custom claim retiriver implmentation by adding the following apim.jwt.enable_user_claims=true. Make sure that it is the fully-qualified class name.

params.name: claim_dialect
params.description: A set of claims are identified as a dialect. Different dialects represent the same piece of information with different claim URIs.

params.name: signing_algorithm
params.description: Specify NONE to disbale the sigining.

options.name: apim.jwt.issuer
options.description: To specify the issuers of the JWT tokens if third-party Key Managers are used.

params.name: name
params.description: The issuer name of the JWT.

options.name: apim.jwt.issuer.jwks
options.description: To specify the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) endpoint of the issuer.

params.name: url
params.description: The JWKS endpoint URL of the issuer.

params.name: remote_claim
params.description: The name of the remote claim.

params.name: local_claim
params.description: The local claim name that the remote claim needs to be mapped to.

options.name: apim.gateway.environment
options.description: Configuring the gateways used by API Manager.

params.name: name
params.description: User can add preferred values as the name.

params.name: display_in_api_console
params.description: Displays the environment under 'Try it' in the API Store, in the API console.

params.name: description
params.default: This is a hybrid gateway that handles both production and sandbox token traffic.
params.description: Describe the function of the gateway here.

params.name: show_as_token_endpoint_url
params.description: Use to construct the sample curl request in the API Store.

params.name: service_url
params.description: APIs will be published using this URL

params.name: username
params.description: Credentials used to publish APIs

params.name: password
params.description: Credentials used to publish APIs

params.name: ws_endpoint
params.description: E.g., ws://localhost:9099

params.name: https_endpoint
params.description: https://localhost:8243/

params.name: http_endpoint
params.description: http://localhost:8280/

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the gateway token cache. WSO2 recommends to enable this feature by default. The token validation request checks with the cached value.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time in minutes. Recommended value is 15 minutes.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the gateway resource cache. Caches the API resources at the gateway. Expires in 15 minutes.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable the Key Manager token cache. The token validation request checks with the value cached at the Key Manager. At any given time you should only have one cache enabled, which is either the Key Manager cache or the API Gateway cache. WSO2 does not recommend using both caches at the same time.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable cache for recently added apis in the API Store. This expires in 15 minutes by default.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enabel cache for scopes. This expires in 15 minutes by default.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable cache for publisher roles. Expires in 15 minutes by default

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable JWT claim cache. The user's claims used to create the JWT are cached.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set the cache expiry time. Would be same as the JWT expiry time.

params.name: expiry_time
params.description: Set when the tag cache expires. This option is disabled when not defined.

params.name: enable
params.description: Set TRUE to enable analytics in API Manager

params.name: store_api_url
params.description: The Store REST API URL for Analytics. If there are mutiple analytics node, use the loadbalancing URL

params.name: username
params.default: Credentials of the super admin user.
params.description: Credentials of the super admin user, in the analytics node

params.name: password
params.default: Credentials of the super admin user.
params.description: Credentials of the super admin user, in the analytics node

params.name: receiver_username
params.description: Change this if a specific user is required for event publishing.

params.name: receiver_password
params.description: Change this if a specific user is required for event publishing.

params.name: store_api_username
params.description: Change this if a specific user is required to access the Store REST API.

params.name: store_api_password
params.description: Change this if a specific user is required to access the Store REST API.

params.name: event_publisher_impl
params.description:
If you have defined a custom "event_publisher_type", the custom publisher needs to be defined to the following value 

 'event_publisher_impl = "org.wso2.carbon.apimgt.usage.publisher.APIMgtUsageDataBridgeDataPublisher"

params.name: publish_response_size
params.description: Set TRUE to enable and define size of the publisher response sent to Analytics. Size is set bytes.
Define each analytics node that the API Manager will connect to, as an array. If there are mutiple node, you need to define this configuration for each node.

params.name: analytics_url
params.description: The list of server URLs e.g.,: analytics_url = ["tcp: //localhost:7611, tcp://localhost:7611"]"

params.name: analytics_auth_url
params.description: The list of auth server URLs e.g.,: analytics_auth_url = ["ssl: //localhost:7711,ssl://localhost:7711"]

params.name: type
params.description: Loadbalance or Failover

params.name: service_url
params.description: URL that offers services of the KM

params.name: username
params.default: Credentials of the super admin user.
params.description: Credentials of the super admin user, in the Key Manager node.

params.name: password
params.default: Credentials of the super admin user.
params.description: Credentials of the super admin user, in the Key Manager node.

params.name: pool.init_idle_capacity
params.description: Minimum no. of clients created, to connect to the key manager.

params.name: pool.max_idle
params.description: Maximum no. of clients created, to connect to the key manager.

params.name: key_validation_handler_type
params.description: If custom, then provide the "key_validation_handler_impl" value

params.name: key_validation_handler_impl
params.description: You can provide a custom key validation handler implmentation. To do this, set the "key_validation_handler_type" to custom

options.name: apim.oauth_config
options.description: Collection of OAuth related configs

params.name: enable_outbound_auth_header
params.description: If TRUE, sends Auth header to the backend as received from the client.

params.name: auth_header
params.description: Valid authorization header for OAuth configurations.

params.name: revoke_endpoint
params.description: Token revocation endpoint used in the API Store

params.name: enable_token_encryption
params.description:
If set to TRUE, the token stored in the database will be encrypted/decrypted when reading and storing. 

 RSA/ECB/OAEPwithSHA1andMGF1PaddingIf FALSE - Setting Up OAuth Token Encryption | Extension Points for OAuth - IS Docs

params.name: enable_token_hashing
params.description: Similar to prev. Get desc from  IS docs

params.name: allowed_scopes
params.description: List of allowlisted scopes. Take desc from Key Concepts page.

options.name: apim.devportal
options.description: Configures the API Developer Portal

params.name: url
params.description: Public store URL

params.name: enable_application_sharing
params.description: Enable application sharing according to the claims.

params.name: application_sharing_type
params.default: If the config is not mentioned, then undefined.default
params.description: Use the application_sharing_impl as default implmentationIf it is saml, the group extractor extracts the claims to group the applications from the saml response.

params.name: application_sharing_impl
params.default: Based on the application sharing type.
params.description: Need to define if the application_sharing_type is custom. If both application_sharing_type and application_sharing_impl is defined, take value from application_sharing_impl.

params.name: login_username_case_insensitive
params.description: Check with new UI

params.name: display_multiple_versions
params.description: If TRUE displays all the versions of the API under the API listing (and search depending on the new UI)

params.name: display_deprecated_apis
params.description: If TRUE displays all the deprecated APIs under the API listing (and search depending on the new UI)

params.name: enable_comments
params.description: Can comment on the API

params.name: enable_ratings
params.description: Enable rating the API with a star-based rating

params.name: application_sharing_claim
params.description: The user claim used to group the applications.

options.name: apim.cors
options.description: Configures CORS headers on the Publisher and the Gateway.

params.name: enable
params.description: CORS configurations are enabled by default.

params.name: allow_origins
params.description: Denotes "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" response header. Specify an origin to share the response with.

params.name: allow_methods
params.description: Configures the methods allowed by the access control.

params.name: allow_headers
params.description: Configures the type of headers allowed by the access control.

params.name: allow_credentials
params.description:
Specifying this header to true means that the server allows cookies (or other user credentials) to be included on cross-origin requests.

 It is false by default and if you set it to true then make sure that the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header does not contain the wildcard (*)

options.name: apim.throttling
options.description: Configures API-M traffic control.

params.name: event_type
params.description: Binary - Uses the binary transport. Recommended.Thrift - Uses thrift tranport

params.name: receiver_url
params.description: Define traffic manager connection url inline. If none of this is defined consider it as "tcp://${carbon.local.ip}:${receiver.url.port}".

params.name: enable_header_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this header to true will enable a user to define header condition throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: enable_unlimited_tier
params.description: Specifying this config to true will disable the unlimited throttling tier of basic throttling configurations.

params.name: enable_jwt_claim_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this config to true will enable a user to define JWT condition throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: enable_query_param_based_throttling
params.description: Specifying this config to true will enable a user to define Query parameter condition throttling policies in the Admin Portal.

params.name: skip_redeploying_policies
params.description: Define an array of throttle policies which don't need to redeploy on startup

params.name: username
params.description: Credentials of the Traffic Manager user.

params.name: password
params.description: Credentials of the Traffic Manager user.

params.name: receiver_username
params.description: If the username of the receiver is different, use the username of the receiver configured on the Traffic Manager.

params.name: receiver_password
params.description: If the credentials of the receiver is different, use the password of the receiver configured on the Traffic Manager.

params.name: policy_deploy.username
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for deploying policies.

params.name: policy_deploy.password
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for deploying policies.

params.name: jms.username
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for the JMS connection.

params.name: jms.password
params.description: If the credentials of the user is different, use the credentials of the user configured for the JMS connection.

params.name: publisher.max_idle
params.description: Ideal values for the maximum no. of connections to the data publisher pool.

params.name: publisher.init_idle_size
params.description: Ideal values for the minimum no. of connections to the data publisher pool.

params.name: publisher.pool_size
params.description: The size of the thread pool in the API Publisher.

params.name: publisher.max_pool_size
params.description: The maximum size of the thread pool in the API Publisher.

params.name: publisher.keep_alive_time
params.description: The timeframe after which the publisher thread pool is terminated.

params.name: service_url
params.description: Service URL of the Traffic Manager.

params.name: blacklist_condition.start_delay
params.description: Define the delay time to get the blacklist conditions from the Keymanager.

params.name: jms.destination
params.description: JMS topic name

params.name: jms.start_delay
params.description: Connection delay to read the Traffic Manager at startup.

params.name: decision_connection_type
params.description: Define the JMS type e.g.,: andes

params.name: jms.java_naming_factory_initial
params.description: Define JMS factory initials. If decision_connection_type is andes, this is "org.wso2.andes.jndi.PropertiesFileInitialContextFactory"

params.name: throttle_decision_endpoints
params.description: Define array of JMS connection as an array.

params.name: enable_unlimited_tier
params.description: Enable the unlimited tier.

params.name: traffic_manager_urls
params.description: [[apim.throttling.url_group]]traffic_manager_urls = ["tcp://localhost:9611","tcp://localhost:9611"]traffic_manager_auth_urls = ["ssl://localhost:9711","ssl://localhost:9711"]type = "loadbalance"

options.name: apim.workflow
options.description: Configures the workflows in API Manager

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable API State Change workflow.

params.name: service_url
params.description: The service URL of the workflow engine.

params.name: wf_engine_user
params.description: Workflow username.

params.name: wf_engine_pass
params.description: Workflow password.

params.name: callback_endpoint
params.description: Callback URL for the workflow engine.

params.name: token_endpoint
params.description: Token endpoint used for the workflow.

params.name: client_registration_endpoint
params.description: DCR endpoint

params.name: client_registration_username
params.description: DCR username

params.name: group_id
params.description: Group ID of the of the generated project.

params.name: artifact_id
params.description: Artifact ID of the generated project.

params.name: model_package
params.description: Model package of the generated project.

params.name: api_package
params.description: API package of the generated project.

params.name: supported_languages
params.description: Supported programming languages.

options.name: apim.open_tracer
options.description: Configurations related to tracing.

params.name: remote_tracer.enable
params.description: Enable tracing in API Manager. Traces the execution time upto message level.

params.name: remote_tracer.name
params.description: Tracer name.

params.name: remote_tracer.properties.hostname
params.description: Hostname of the zipkin tool (tracer)

params.name: remote_tracer.properties.port
params.description: Port allocated for the tool.

params.name: log_tracer.enable
params.description: Define whether to log the tracer values.

options.name: apim.token.revocation
options.description: Configures the token revocation on KM

params.name: notifier_impl
params.description:
This config is required only during a custom implementation. 

If a token is revoked, the notification will be sent to the JMS topic. Write a custom implementation to change this behaviour.

params.name: enable_realtime_notifier
params.description: (Only applicable if the Microgateway is used)If set to FALSE, works as persistent.

params.name: enable_persistent_notifier
params.description: Notifications will be persisted to etcd. At the microgateway server startup, the etcd will be queried by the microgateway.

params.name: persistent_notifier.hostname
params.description: etcd hostname

params.name: from_address
params.description: The email address you use to send emails.

params.name: username
params.description: The email address used to authenticate the mail server. This can be the same email address as the from_address.

params.name: password
params.description: Password used to authenticate the mail server.

params.name: hostname
params.description: The SMTP server to connect to.

params.name: port
params.description: The SMTP server port to connect to, if the connect() method does not explicitly specify one. Defaults to 25.

params.name: enable_start_tls
params.description: If true, enables the use of the `STARTTLS` command (if supported by the server, before issuing any login commands). Note that an appropriate trust store must be configured so that the client will trust the certificate of the server. Defaults to false.

params.name: enable_authentication
params.description: If true, it attempts to authenticate the user using the AUTH command. Defaults to false.

params.name: enable_email_domain
params.description: Enable email login for tenant users.

options.name: multi_tenancy.stratos
options.description: Configures the multi-tenant Stratos properties.

params.name: disable_tenant_management_emails
params.description: Disable tenant management emails for tenant users.

params.name: email_validation_mandatory_for_login

params.name: tenant_activation_moderated
params.description: Enable or disable activation of moderated tenants.

params.name: super_admin_email

params.name: skip_summary_generator
params.description: Skip summary generator for tenants.

params.name: notification_email

params.name: finance_notification_email

params.name: charge_on_registration

params.name: public_cloud_setup
params.description: Enable or disable public cloud setup for tenants.

params.name: google_analytics_url
params.description: URL address of Google Analytics.

params.name: sso_loading_message
params.description: The message that is displayed when SSO is loaded.

params.name: password

params.name: signature
params.description: TThe signature of the attached PayPal account.

params.name: environment
params.description: The environment of the attached PayPal account.

params.description: Use as the default cloud service or not.

params.name: label
params.description: Label value that represents the cloud service.

params.description: Description of the cloud service.
